text: In a managed services data center relocation in utilities where hardware lead times are long and a tender deadline is approaching, what should the project manager do to plan and manage procurement strategy?

options.label: perform make-or-buy and select appropriate contract types
choose vendors solely on lowest price
skip a procurement plan to save time
sign contracts without legal review

explanation: Option a is correct because strategy depends on delivery approach and risk. Option b is incorrect because price-only decisions may ignore risk and value. Option c is incorrect because lack of plan leads to inconsistency. Option d is incorrect because legal oversight protects the project.

text: Given a design-bid-build grid upgrade in construction where vendors control key components and operations must support handover, which action best supports plan and manage procurement strategy?

options.label: ignore market conditions when planning
define evaluation criteria and sourcing approach
delay sourcing decisions until materials are needed
choose vendors solely on lowest price

explanation: Option b is correct because clear criteria drive fair selection. Option a is incorrect because market factors affect strategy. Option c is incorrect because late sourcing risks shortages. Option d is incorrect because price-only decisions may ignore risk and value.

text: While facing a turnkey grid upgrade in utilities where specialized skills are scarce and budget approval is pending, what is the most effective next step to plan and manage procurement strategy?

options.label: skip a procurement plan to save time
sign contracts without legal review
align procurement timelines with project milestones
ignore market conditions when planning

explanation: Option c is correct because timeline alignment prevents delays. Option a is incorrect because lack of plan leads to inconsistency. Option b is incorrect because legal oversight protects the project. Option d is incorrect because market factors affect strategy.

text: For a managed services grid upgrade in biotech where supplier performance is uneven and compliance terms are strict, what should the project manager do first to plan and manage procurement strategy?

skip a procurement plan to save time

explanation: Option d is correct because risk sharing influences contract choice. Option a is incorrect because late sourcing risks shortages. Option b is incorrect because price-only decisions may ignore risk and value. Option c is incorrect because lack of plan leads to inconsistency.
